about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?

about.name: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications? | Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

suggestedAnswer.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

comment.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

suggestedAnswer.text: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.

comment.text: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.

suggestedAnswer.text: Medications are safe to take at any time, if prescribed by a doctor.

comment.text: Medications are safe to take at any time, if prescribed by a doctor.

acceptedAnswer.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

comment.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

answerExplanation.text: Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

comment.text: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications? | Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

hasPart.name: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light:

about.name: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light:

hasPart.assesses: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light: | As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A flashing yellow light means that you should slow down, check for cross traffic, and proceed with caution.

comment.text: Stop before crossing the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

comment.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait for a green light before proceeding.

comment.text: Wait for a green light before proceeding.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

comment.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

answerExplanation.text: A flashing yellow light means that you should slow down, check for cross traffic, and proceed with caution.

hasPart.name: You may pass a vehicle when:

about.name: You may pass a vehicle when:

hasPart.assesses: You may pass a vehicle when: | You may pass a vehicle when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A single broken line indicates that drivers may cross from either lane to change lanes. Dashed yellow lines alongside solid yellow lines indicate that passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line, but not from the lane next to the solid line. Only change lanes when it is safe to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are on a hill or curve.

comment.text: You are on a hill or curve.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are on a road with a solid line next to your lane.

comment.text: You are on a road with a solid line next to your lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are on a road with a broken line next to your lane.

comment.text: You are on a road with a broken line next to your lane.

acceptedAnswer.text: You are on a road with a broken line next to your lane.

comment.text: You are on a road with a broken line next to your lane.

answerExplanation.text: A single broken line indicates that drivers may cross from either lane to change lanes. Dashed yellow lines alongside solid yellow lines indicate that passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line, but not from the lane next to the solid line. Only change lanes when it is safe to do so.

comment.text: You may pass a vehicle when: | A single broken line indicates that drivers may cross from either lane to change lanes. Dashed yellow lines alongside solid yellow lines indicate that passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line, but not from the lane next to the solid line. Only change lanes when it is safe to do so.

hasPart.name: When using a roundabout, drivers should:

about.name: When using a roundabout, drivers should:

hasPart.assesses: When using a roundabout, drivers should: | When using a roundabout, drivers should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A roundabout is a circular intersection that usually does not include a traffic signal and flows in a counterclockwise direction around a central island. Motorists must enter from the right, yielding to traffic already in the roundabout, and follow the circle to the right until the desired roadway is reached.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop in the middle of the roundabout.

comment.text: Stop in the middle of the roundabout.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.

comment.text: Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.
Yield to entering traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.

comment.text: Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.

answerExplanation.text: A roundabout is a circular intersection that usually does not include a traffic signal and flows in a counterclockwise direction around a central island. Motorists must enter from the right, yielding to traffic already in the roundabout, and follow the circle to the right until the desired roadway is reached.

comment.text: When using a roundabout, drivers should: | A roundabout is a circular intersection that usually does not include a traffic signal and flows in a counterclockwise direction around a central island. Motorists must enter from the right, yielding to traffic already in the roundabout, and follow the circle to the right until the desired roadway is reached.

hasPart.name: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should:

about.name: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should: | If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive at a constant speed to gain better traction.

comment.text: Drive at a constant speed to gain better traction.

suggestedAnswer.text: Apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.

comment.text: Apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

comment.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

comment.text: Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.

answerExplanation.text: When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

comment.text: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should: | When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that your current road ends at an intersection straight ahead. Slow down and prepare to yield or stop before turning right or left.

comment.text: Right turn.
Intersection.
Lane change.
Intersection.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that your current road ends at an intersection straight ahead. Slow down and prepare to yield or stop before turning right or left.
